Class ec.ifc.app.ECTwoControlCGItem

                                   +----ec.ifc.app.ECTwoControlCGItem
public class ECTwoControlCGItem
extends ECSimpleCGItem
This extension of ECSimpleCGItem adds a second arbitrary View on the right of each item. This second View's size is not adjusted automatically. A typical use of this class is to create a list of labelled controls, each of which also has a check box on the right.

DEFAULT_SECOND_CONTROL_SPACE
mySecondControl
the view that's displayed over on the right
mySecondControlSpace
size of the space in which the second control is horiz.

ECTwoControlCGItem()
Returns a new ECTwoControlCGItem with no controls, label field, or label, and a height of 0.
ECTwoControlCGItem(View, View, TextField, String, int)
Returns a new ECTwoControlCGItem with the specified controls, label field, label, and height.

getSecondControl()
Returns the subview that's drawn on the right edge, typically a checkbox or some other small marker.
getSecondControlSpace()
Returns the amount of space in which the second control is horizontally centered.
layoutContents(int)
Overridden to call positionSecondControl() after calling super()
positionControl(int)
Overridden to make automatically-sized control leave room for second control.
positionSecondControl(int)
Positions second control centered in secondControlSpace() at right edge of item.
setSecondControl(View)
Sets the second control subview.
setSecondControlSpace(int)
Sets the amount of space in which the second control is horizontally centered.

DEFAULT_SECOND_CONTROL_SPACE

ECTwoControlCGItem 
  public ECTwoControlCGItem()
Returns a new ECTwoControlCGItem with no controls, label field, or label, and a height of 0. You can change the height of an ECControlGroup item before adding it to an ECControlGroup, but not afterwards.
ECTwoControlCGItem 
  public ECTwoControlCGItem(View control,
                            View secondControl,
                            TextField labelField,
                            String label,
                            int height)
Returns a new ECTwoControlCGItem with the specified controls, label field, label, and height. control is positioned after the label, and resizes automatically. secondControl is positioned on the right edge, and cannot be made to resize automatically.
See Also:
setControlResizesAutomatically
